CONTENTS.P: Procurement reference: 9041-IFT-39989
Project name: Dushanbe Public Transport
Country: Republic of Tajikistan
Business sector: Municipal and environmental infrastructure
Project ID: 39989
Funding source: EBRD, SSF
Type of contract: Project goods, works and services
Type of notice: Invitation for tenders
Issue date: 28.3.2018
Closing date: 15.5.2018 at 15:00 (local time)

This invitation for tenders follows the General procurement notice for this project which was published on the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) website, procurement notices (www.ebrd.com) on 4.9.2015 and updated on 25.1.2018.

Dushanbe state communal unitary enterprise “Trolleybus” hereinafter referred to as “the Purchaser”, intends to use part of the proceeds of a loan and a grant from the Bank for the Dushanbe public transport project.
The purchaser now invites sealed tenders from suppliers for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan and the grant:
Package #DPTP04: Supply of trolleybuses with increased autonomous run (4 units with minimal sets of spare parts, maintenance equipments and related services)
The trolleybuses are to be delivered within 16 weeks after receipt of the advance payment on DDP (Final Place of Destination in Dushanbe) terms as adjusted by the contract conditions.
Tendering for contract that is to be financed with the proceeds of the loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers shall satisfy the following minimum criteria:

a) Tenderers shall meet the eligibility requirements: no conflicts of interests, not having been declared ineligible by the Bank, compliance with requirements of tender documents for government owned entity if a tenderer is owned by the government, not having been excluded as a result of the Borrower’s country laws or by an act of compliance with UN Security Council resolution.

b) In the case of a tenderer offering to supply trolleybuses under the Contract which the tenderer does not manufacture, the tenderer shall submit with its tender the Authorisation of manufacturer of trolleybuses.

c) A tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, shall not have a consistent history of litigation and/or arbitration resulting in awards against the tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, within 2015 — 2017 the last 3 years, based on all information on fully settled disputes or litigation. All pending litigation shall in total not represent more than 20 % of the tenderer’s net worth and shall be treated as resolved against the tenderer;

d) Tenderer shall submit audited balance sheets or other financial statements acceptable to the Purchaser, for 2014 — 2016 the last 3 years to demonstrate the current soundness of the tenderer’s financial position, showing long-term profitability;
e) Minimum average annual turnover of USD 4 mln or its equivalent, calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress or completed, within the last 3 years 2014 — 2016.

f) Tenderer must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means, other than any contractual advance payments to meet production cash flow for the contract estimated as not less than 80 % of the tender price, taking into account the Tenderer's commitments for other contracts;
g) A Tenderer has effected a successful supply of at least 100 trolleybuses of any model over the past 3 years (2015 — 2017);

h) The manufacturer shall have the general experience as manufacturer of trolleybuses with autonomous run for not less than 5 years including not less than 2 years’ experience as manufacturer of the models substantially similar to the model offered in the tender;

i) The manufacturer shall demonstrate the experience in production of at least 20 trolleybuses with IAR which have to be substantially similar to those offered in the tender and should be successfully in operation for at least 1 year;
j) The manufacturer must have a certificate of quality management system (ISO 9000, or its equivalent).

Tender documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a nonrefundable fee of USD 100 (one hundred), including VAT, or equivalent in Tajik Somoni or in Russian Ruble at the exchange rate of National Bank of Tajikistan on the date of payment.
Payment of a non-refundable fee shall be made by direct bank transfer to the following account:
Currency: TJS
Beneficiary: SCUE “Trolleybus”
Beneficiary’s bank: State saving Bank of Tajikistan “Amonatbonk”, Dushanbe, Tajikistan
SWIFT: ASSETJ22
Currency: USD
Beneficiary: SCUE “Trolleybus”
Beneficiary’s bank: State saving Bank of Tajikistan “Amonatbonk”, Dushanbe, Tajikistan
SWIFT: ASSETJ22
Bank correspondent: Sberbank, Moscow, Russia
SWIFT: SABRRUMM
Intermediary bank: Bank of New York, New York, NY, US
SWIFT: IRVTUS3N
C/Account No.: 890-0057-610
Currency: RUB
Beneficiary: SCUE “Trolleybus”
Beneficiary’s bank: State saving Bank of Tajikistan “Amonatbonk”, Dushanbe, Tajikistan
SWIFT: ASSETJ22
Bank correspondent: Sberbank, Moscow, Russia
SWIFT: SABRRUMM012

Upon receipt of appropriate evidence of payment of the non-refundable fee, the documents will be promptly dispatched by courier; however, no liability can be accepted for their loss or late delivery. If requested, the documents can also be dispatched electronically after presentation by the prospective tenderer of appropriate evidence of payment of the non-refundable fee. In the event of discrepancy between electronic and hard copies of the documents, the hard copy shall prevail.
All tenders must be accompanied by a Tender security of 18 000 (eighteen thousand) USD or its equivalent in a convertible currency.

Tenders must be delivered to the office at the address below on or before 15.5.2018, 15:00 hrs (local time), at which time they will be opened in the presence of those tenderers’ representatives who choose to attend:
State Committee for Investments and Management of state assets
Box #2 (slot 8 x 24 cm), Office 9, 27, Shotemura str., Dushanbe, 734025, Republic of Tajikistan
The applicable procurement rules are the Bank’s Procurement Policies and Rules (PP&R) which can be located at: http://www.ebrd.com/news/publications/policies/procurement-policies-and-rules.html
A register of potential tenderers who have purchased the tender documents may be inspected at the address below.
Prospective tenderers may obtain further information from, and also inspect and acquire the tender documents at, the following office:

This invitation for tenders follows the General procurement notice for this project which was published on the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) website, procurement notices (www.ebrd.com) on 4.9.2015 and updated on 25.1.2018.

Dushanbe state communal unitary enterprise “Trolleybus” hereinafter referred to as “the Purchaser”, intends to use part of the proceeds of a loan and a grant from the Bank for the Dushanbe public transport project.
The purchaser now invites sealed tenders from suppliers for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan and the grant:
Package #DPTP04: Supply of trolleybuses with increased autonomous run (4 units with minimal sets of spare parts, maintenance equipments and related services)
The trolleybuses are to be delivered within 16 weeks after receipt of the advance payment on DDP (Final Place of Destination in Dushanbe) terms as adjusted by the contract conditions.
Tendering for contract that is to be financed with the proceeds of the loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers shall satisfy the following minimum criteria:

a) Tenderers shall meet the eligibility requirements: no conflicts of interests, not having been declared ineligible by the Bank, compliance with requirements of tender documents for government owned entity if a tenderer is owned by the government, not having been excluded as a result of the Borrower’s country laws or by an act of compliance with UN Security Council resolution.

b) In the case of a tenderer offering to supply trolleybuses under the Contract which the tenderer does not manufacture, the tenderer shall submit with its tender the Authorisation of manufacturer of trolleybuses.

c) A tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, shall not have a consistent history of litigation and/or arbitration resulting in awards against the tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, within 2015 — 2017 the last 3 years, based on all information on fully settled disputes or litigation. All pending litigation shall in total not represent more than 20 % of the tenderer’s net worth and shall be treated as resolved against the tenderer;

d) Tenderer shall submit audited balance sheets or other financial statements acceptable to the Purchaser, for 2014 — 2016 the last 3 years to demonstrate the current soundness of the tenderer’s financial position, showing long-term profitability;
e) Minimum average annual turnover of USD 4 mln or its equivalent, calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress or completed, within the last 3 years 2014 — 2016.

f) Tenderer must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means, other than any contractual advance payments to meet production cash flow for the contract estimated as not less than 80 % of the tender price, taking into account the Tenderer's commitments for other contracts;
g) A Tenderer has effected a successful supply of at least 100 trolleybuses of any model over the past 3 years (2015 — 2017);

h) The manufacturer shall have the general experience as manufacturer of trolleybuses with autonomous run for not less than 5 years including not less than 2 years’ experience as manufacturer of the models substantially similar to the model offered in the tender;

i) The manufacturer shall demonstrate the experience in production of at least 20 trolleybuses with IAR which have to be substantially similar to those offered in the tender and should be successfully in operation for at least 1 year;
j) The manufacturer must have a certificate of quality management system (ISO 9000, or its equivalent).
